column107: Special Notes
For all Agricultural Districts Chapter 205 includes the following statement "including clusters of single-family farm dwellings permitted within agricultural parks developed by the State"
Setbacks, minimum individual lot sizes, etc are not specified in a project district. In the APD, there's a density guideline, but it's up to the interpretation of the project by the board

Parking requirements: possibly 0 for SFH if dwelling density is lower than 1 unit per 1,000 square feet of land; 3/4+ Housing - permitted with a maximum density of five hundred square feet of land area per rentable unit or dwelling unit; Setbacks - 0 except as required by plan approval; Parking - The number of parking spaces required for double-family, duplex and multiple-family residential dwellings having a density greater than one thousand square feet of land area per rentable unit or dwelling unit within the CDH zoning district shall be one off-street parking space per unit; 3/4+ parking - one for each unit on a property maintaining a unit density higher than one thousand square feet of land area per rentable unit or dwelling unit.

3/4+-Housing - permitted provided that the maximum density shall be one thousand two hundred fifty square feet of land area per rentable unit or dwelling unit; The height limit in the City of Hilo shall be one hundred twenty feet; Side yards, none, except where the adjoining building site is in an RS, RD, RM or RCX district. Where the side yard adjoins the side yard of a building site in an RS, RD, RM or RCX district, there shall be a side yard which conforms to the side yard requirements for dwelling use of the adjoining district.

missing MG10

Any uses permitted either directly or conditionally in the RS, RD, RM, RCX, CN, CG, CV or V districts shall be permitted in a project district; provided, that each of the proposed uses and the overall densities for residential and hotel uses shall be contained in a master plan for the project district and in the project district enabling ordinance.

column5: Residential-Commercial Mixed Use Districts - 10,000 square feet
column107: Where commercial uses are integrated with residential uses in the RCX district, pedestrian access to the dwelling shall be independent from other uses and shall be designed to enhance privacy for residents; No floor of any building in the RCX district shall be used for both dwelling and commercial purposes; There may be more than one main building on any building site in the RCX district; Distance between main buildings on the same building site in the RCX district shall be at least fifteen feet., Side yards, eight feet for a one-story building, plus an additional two feet for each additional story.

column107:
Sec. 21-5.250 Farm dwellings.
(a) In the AG-1 district, the number of farm dwellings shall not exceed one for each five acres of lot area. In
the AG-2 district, the number of farm dwellings shall not exceed one for each two acres of lot area.
(b) Each farm dwelling and any accessory uses shall be contained within an area not to exceed 5,000 square
feet of the lot

Sec. 21-5.250 Farm dwellings.
(a) In the AG-1 district, the number of farm dwellings shall not exceed one for each five acres of lot area. In
the AG-2 district, the number of farm dwellings shall not exceed one for each two acres of lot area.
(b) Each farm dwelling and any accessory uses shall be contained within an area not to exceed 5,000 square
feet of the lot

column21: None, "Building area" includes "all-weather surfaces", which are basically roads or concrete pads for building on, but do not include all impervious surfaces
column22:
Excluding carport or garage areas: 
2 per unit up to 3,249 square feet of floor area
3 per unit from 3,250 to 3,999 square feet of floor area
4 per unit from 4,000 to 4,749 square feet of floor rea
1 additional for each 750 square feet of floor area over 4,000 square feet
column24:
Baseline: 15 ft    

If w/ height setbacks:  25 ft, set back from every side
and rear buildable area boundary line one foot for each two feet of additional height above 15 feet 

Except if lot has a slope of 15 degrees or greater, in which case the maximum height varies from 20 feet at the edge of the buildable area along to up to 30 feet along a line measured 60 degrees from the horizontal top of the 20 foot heigh.

column16: The minimum distance of any building from the right-of-way line of a public or private street or the pavement line of a driveway or parking lot used by the public shall be five (5) feet unless the building is entered from that side by motor vehicles in which case the minimum distance shall be fifteen (15) feet.
column106:
1 dormitory = 1/2 of one dwelling unit

Permits:
- Class I Permit if Use Permit or a Variance Permit not required; development prohibited in Constraint District or Special Treatment District
- Class IV Permit for >100 dormitory units, or if Class I permit requires Use Permit or Variance Permit
- Applicant shall show compliance, and submit plot plan where necessary

Waste Lines:
- Must be screened by fence, wall, hedge, or plant screen from public thoroughfares when serving >2 dwelling units
- If <10 dwelling units/acre on parcel, all lines (electric, distribution, telephone, gas, cable, etc.) must be installed underground unless scenic and environmental values better protected otherwise

Underground Line Exemptions:
- Lines used exclusively for fire/police alarm boxes, lighting, or traffic control;
- Overhead wires attached to exterior of one building
- Belonging to underground facilities if they harmonize with area
